SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

co.cask.cdap.api.annotation
Annotation Type Batch

@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Batch

Annotates a Flowlet's method to indicate that it will process its input in batch.

By default, a Flowlet processes a single data object at a time within a single transaction. To increase throughput, you can process a batch of data objects within the same transaction: 


 @Batch(100)
 @ProcessInput
 public void process(Iterator<String> words) {
   ...
 }

In this example, 100 data objects are dequeued at one time and processed within a single transaction. Note that the signature of the method in the above example has an Iterator over the input type.

You could also keep the argument as an individual input type: 


 @Batch(100)
 @ProcessInput
 public void process(String word) {
   ...
 }

By doing so, the process method will be called repeatedly by the system for each input in the dequeued batch within single transaction.

If you use batch processing, your transactions can take longer and the probability of a conflict due to a failed process increases (see hash partitioning).

See the Cask DAP Developer Guides for more information.

See Also:
HashPartition

Required Element Summary
 int value
          Declare the maximum number of objects that can be processed in a batch.
 

Element Detail

value

public abstract int value
Declare the maximum number of objects that can be processed in a batch.
